qa_examples.q: Which RNZ product is suitable for tomatoes during flowering?
qa_examples.a: High-potassium grades help at flowering and fruiting. Consider Water Soluble NPK 06-12-36 or Suspension NPK 0-52-34. Apply via fertigation or foliar under adequate moisture.

qa_examples.q: What works best on alkaline soil for fruit trees?
qa_examples.a: Use products compatible with alkaline conditions: Suspension Items (e.g., NPK 0-52-34), Sulphur Based items for sulphur and micronutrient correction (e.g., RNZ SB+Zn 8%), and chelated micros like Fe EDDHA 6%.

qa_examples.q: Do you have a liquid option for quick nitrogen?
qa_examples.a: Yes. Liquid Items include Urea Liquid for fast nitrogen delivery via fertigation or foliar. Ensure proper dilution and application timing in vegetative stages.
Water Soluble NPK grades (e.g., NPK 19-19-19, NPK 20-20-20) and certain Liquid Items (e.g., Seaweed Liquid, Liquid NPK’s) are commonly used in hydroponics due to full solubility.

qa_examples.q: What’s the difference between Liquid and Suspension items?
qa_examples.a: Liquid Items are true solutions for rapid correction across stages; Suspension Items are stable slurries delivering higher analysis NPK, often targeted to flowering/fruiting phases.

policies.answer_scope: Only answer using this RNZ knowledge base. If a question is outside scope, say you don't have that information.
policies.citation_hint: When possible, reference the product name(s) used to form the answer.
fallbacks: If a product name is not found, suggest browsing the RNZ catalog categories.
If the user asks for dosage/application rates not present, respond that specific rates depend on crop and local conditions and are not provided here.
policies.style: Concise, agronomy-aware, avoid safety/regulatory advice not included here.
